item.title: Saskatoon
item.description: There’s a web server access log file at /home/admin/access.log. The file consists of one line per HTTP request, with the requester’s IP address at the beginning of each line. Link to heading Find what’s the IP address that has the most requests in this file (there’s no tie; the IP is unique). Write the solution into a file /home/admin/highestip.txt. For example, if your solution is “1.2.3.4”, you can do echo "1.

item.title: Saint John
item.description: A developer created a testing program that is continuously writing to a log file /var/log/bad.log and filling up disk. You can check for example with tail -f /var/log/bad.log. This program is no longer needed. Find it and terminate it. Link to heading So, since we know that this program is continuously writing to a log file we can use the lsof command. This command stands for “list open files” and what it does is that it lists open files opened by processes.
